greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = LCM of run lengths in binary representation of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10922
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to lcm's
example: For n=12, A007088(12) = "1100" in binary, the run lengths are [2,2], thus a(12) = lcm(2,2) = 2.
program: (define (A284559 n) (reduce lcm 1 (binexp->runcount1list n))) ;; For binexp->runcount1list, see the Program section of A227349.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 14 2017
